azureLogAnalytics.query:
//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

| order by TimeGenerated asc

let rawData = AzureDiagnostics 
    // Ignore Authentication operations with a 401. This is normal when using Key Vault SDK, first an unauthenticated request is done then the response is used for authentication.
    | where Category == "AuditEvent" and not (OperationName == "Authentication" and httpStatusCode_d == 401)
    | where OperationName in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet') or '*' in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet')
    // Create ResultStatus with all the 'success' results bucked as 'Success'
    // Certain operations like StorageAccountAutoSyncKey have no ResultSignature, for now set to 'Success' as well
    | extend ResultStatus = case (ResultSignature == "", "Success",
        ResultSignature == "OK", "Success",
        ResultSignature == "Accepted", "Success",
        ResultSignature);                            
rawData 
| make-series Trend = count() default = 0 on TimeGenerated from ago(1d) to now() step 30m by ResultStatus
| join kind = inner (rawData
    | where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)
    | summarize Count = count() by ResultStatus
    )
    on ResultStatus
    

| project ResultStatus, Count, Trend
| order by Count desc;

let rawData = AzureDiagnostics 
    // Ignore Authentication operations with a 401. This is normal when using Key Vault SDK, first an unauthenticated request is done then the response is used for authentication.
    | where Category == "AuditEvent" and not (OperationName == "Authentication" and httpStatusCode_d == 401)
    | where OperationName in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet') or '*' in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet')
    // Create ResultStatus with all the 'success' results bucked as 'Success'
    // Certain operations like StorageAccountAutoSyncKey have no ResultSignature, for now set to 'Success' as well
    | extend ResultStatus = case (ResultSignature == "", "Success",
        ResultSignature == "OK", "Success",
        ResultSignature == "Accepted", "Success",
        ResultSignature);                            
rawData
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)
| extend resultCount = iif(ResultStatus == "Success", 1, 0)
| summarize count(resultCount) by bin(TimeGenerated, 30m)
| sort by TimeGenerated;

let rawData = AzureDiagnostics 
    // Ignore Authentication operations with a 401. This is normal when using Key Vault SDK, first an unauthenticated request is done then the response is used for authentication.
    | where Category == "AuditEvent" and not (OperationName == "Authentication" and httpStatusCode_d == 401)
    | where OperationName in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet') or '*' in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet');                     
rawData 
| make-series Trend = count() default = 0 on TimeGenerated from ago(1d) to now() step 30m by ResultSignature 
| join kind = inner (rawData
    | where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)
    | summarize Count = count() by ResultSignature 
    )
    on ResultSignature 


| project ResultSignature , Count, Trend
| order by Count desc;

let rawData = AzureDiagnostics 
    // Ignore Authentication operations with a 401. This is normal when using Key Vault SDK, first an unauthenticated request is done then the response is used for authentication.
    | where Category == "AuditEvent" and not (OperationName == "Authentication" and httpStatusCode_d == 401)
    | where OperationName in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet') or '*' in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet');                          
rawData
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)
| summarize count(ResultSignature ) by bin(TimeGenerated, 30m)
| sort by TimeGenerated;

let data = AzureDiagnostics 
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(1d)
    // Ignore Authentication operations with a 401. This is normal when using Key Vault SDK, first an unauthenticated request is done then the response is used for authentication.
    | where Category == "AuditEvent" and not (OperationName == "Authentication" and httpStatusCode_d == 401)
    | where OperationName in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet') or '*' in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet')
    // Create ResultStatus with all the 'success' results bucked as 'Success'
    // Certain operations like StorageAccountAutoSyncKey have no ResultSignature, for now set to 'Success' as well
    | extend ResultStatus = case (ResultSignature == "", "Success",
        ResultSignature == "OK", "Success",
        ResultSignature == "Accepted", "Success",
        ResultSignature)
    | where ResultStatus == 'All' or 'All' == 'All';
data
// Data aggregated to the OperationName
| summarize OperationCount = count(), SuccessCount = countif(ResultStatus == "Success"), FailureCount = countif(ResultStatus != "Success"), PDurationMs = percentile(DurationMs, 99) by Resource, OperationName
| join kind=inner (data
    | make-series Trend = count() default = 0 on TimeGenerated from ago(1d) to now() step 30m by OperationName
    | project-away TimeGenerated)
    on OperationName
| order by OperationCount desc
| project Name = strcat('⚡ ', OperationName), Id = strcat(Resource, '/', OperationName), ['Operation count'] = OperationCount, ['Operation count trend'] = Trend, ['Success count'] = SuccessCount, ['Failure count'] = FailureCount, ['p99 Duration'] = PDurationMs

let gridRowSelected = dynamic({"Id": "*"});
let resourceName = split(gridRowSelected.Id, "/")[0];
let operationName = split(gridRowSelected.Id, "/")[1];
AzureDiagnostics 
| where TimeGenerated > ago(1d)
// Ignore Authentication operations with a 401. This is normal when using Key Vault SDK, first an unauthenticated request is done then the response is used for authentication.
| where Category == "AuditEvent" and not (OperationName == "Authentication" and httpStatusCode_d == 401)
| where OperationName in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet') or '*' in ('SecretGet', 'VaultGet')
| where resourceName == "*" or Resource == resourceName
| where operationName == "" or OperationName == operationName
// Create ResultStatus with all the 'success' results bucked as 'Success'
// Certain operations like StorageAccountAutoSyncKey have no ResultSignature, for now set to 'Success' as well
| extend ResultStatus = case (ResultSignature == "", "Success",
    ResultSignature == "OK", "Success",
    ResultSignature == "Accepted", "Success",
    ResultSignature)
| where ResultStatus == 'All' or 'All' == 'All'
| extend p = pack_all()
| mv-apply p on 
    ( 
    extend key = tostring(bag_keys(p)[0])
    | where isnotempty(p[key]) and isnotnull(p[key])
    | where key !in ("SourceSystem", "Type")
    | summarize make_bag(p)
    )
| project Time=TimeGenerated, Operation=OperationName, Result=ResultSignature, Duration = DurationMs, ["Details"]=bag_p
| sort by Time desc

panels.description: Provides an overview of the secret operation SecretSet, SecretDelete & SecretRecover.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
AzureDiagnostics
| where TimeGenerated > ago(7d)
| where ResourceProvider =="MICROSOFT.KEYVAULT"
| where OperationName == "SecretSet" or OperationName == "SecretDelete" or OperationName == "SecretRecover"
| extend TargetSecret = tostring(split(id_s, "/")[4])
| extend CallerId = iif(
                        isempty(identity_claim_unique_name_s),
                        identity_claim_appid_g,
                        identity_claim_unique_name_s)
| sort by TimeGenerated desc
| project TimeGenerated, Resource, OperationName, ResultSignature, TargetSecret, CallerId, CallerIPAddress

panels.title: Overview secret operations

panels.description: This shows all the keyvaults in this subscription and if they have public access enabled.

azureResourceGraph.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.keyvault/vaults"
| extend publicAccess = properties.publicNetworkAccess
| project name, resourceGroup, publicAccess, location, subscriptionId

panels.title: Keyvaults Public Access Settings
